verses.text: 馬利亞用香膏膏主逾越節前六天，耶穌到了伯大尼，就是拉撒路所住的地方；耶穌曾經使這拉撒路從死人中復活。

words.note: Refers to Jesus as 'Lord'.
Lit. 'exceed-cross festival', referring to the angel 'passing over' houses.
Indicates a passive or emphasizes action.

verses.text: 有人在那裡為耶穌預備了筵席。馬大在那裡侍候，拉撒路也和一些人與耶穌一同吃飯。
馬利亞拿了半公斤珍貴純正的哪噠香膏，抹耶穌的腳，又用自己的頭髮去擦；屋裡就滿了香膏的香氣。

words.note: 哪噠 is a transliteration for 'nard'.

verses.text: 耶穌的一個門徒，就是那要出賣他的加略人猶大，說：

words.note: Refers to Judas Iscariot, a man from Kerioth.

verses.text: 「為甚麼不把這香膏賣三百銀幣，賙濟窮人呢？」

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.

verses.text: 他說這話，並不是因為他關懷窮人，而是因為他是個賊，又帶著錢囊，常取其中所存的。

words.note: 帶 (dài) means 'to carry', -著 (-zhe) indicates ongoing action or state.
所 forms a nominalized phrase, often indicating a passive or result.

verses.text: 耶穌就說：「由她吧，這香膏是她留下來為我安葬的日子用的。
你們常常有窮人跟你們在一起，卻不常有我。」
有一大群猶太人知道耶穌在那裡，就都來了，然而他們不單是為了耶穌的緣故，也是要看看耶穌使他從死人中復活的拉撒路。

words.note: Reduplication indicates a brief, casual, or tentative action.

verses.text: 於是祭司長想把拉撒路也殺掉，

words.note: Preposition used to mark a direct object placed before the verb.

verses.text: 因為有許多猶太人為了拉撒路的緣故，離開他們，信了耶穌。
騎驢進耶路撒冷第二天，有一大群上來過節的人，聽見耶穌要來耶路撒冷，
就拿著棕樹枝出去迎接他，歡呼說：「和散那，奉主名來的以色列王，是應當稱頌的！」

words.definition: in the name of, by order of
words.note: Formal/religious usage meaning 'to respectfully receive/offer' or 'by order of'.
Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.

verses.text: 耶穌找到一頭小驢，就騎在上面，正如經上所記的：

words.note: Measure word for certain animals (e.g., cattle, donkeys).

verses.text: 「錫安的居民哪，不要懼怕；看哪，你的王來了，他騎著小驢來了。」

words.note: Indicates a plea or exclamation.
Often used to draw attention to something important, similar to 'lo!' in KJV.

verses.text: 門徒起初不明白這些事，可是到耶穌得了榮耀以後，他們才想起這些話是指著他說的，並且人們果然向他這樣行了。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower' or 'one who enters the gate'

verses.text: 那些和耶穌在一起，看見他叫拉撒路從墳墓出來，又使他從死人中復活的群眾，都為這事作見證。
群眾因為聽見他行了這神蹟，就去迎接他。
於是法利賽人彼此說：「你們看，你們都是徒勞無功，世人都去跟隨他了！」

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to work hard but achieve nothing'.

verses.text: 主被舉起來就吸引萬人上去過節作禮拜的人中，有些是希臘人。

words.note: Literally 'ten thousand people', used idiomatically for 'all people' or 'a great multitude'.

verses.text: 他們來到加利利的伯賽大人腓力那裡，請求他，說：「先生，我們想見耶穌。」

words.note: Here, combined with 'Bethsaida' to mean 'Bethsaidan'

verses.text: 腓力去告訴安得烈，安得烈就和腓力去告訴耶穌。
耶穌對他們說：「人子得榮耀的時候到了！

words.note: A specific title for Jesus in the Bible.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 我實實在在告訴你們，一粒麥子若不落在地裡死了，仍舊是一粒；如果死了，就結出許多果實來。

words.note: Biblical phrase often translated 'Verily, verily' or 'Truly, truly'.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates coming into being or result.

verses.text: 愛惜自己生命的，就喪掉生命；在這世上恨惡自己生命的，必會保全生命到永遠。

words.note: Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who...'

verses.text: 如果有人服事我，就應當跟從我；我在哪裡，服事我的人也會在哪裡；如果有人服事我，我父必尊重他。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in Christian context.

verses.text: 「我現在心裡煩亂，我應該說甚麼呢？說『父啊，救我脫離這時刻』嗎？然而我正是為了這個緣故來的，要面對這時刻。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in Christian context.

verses.text: 父啊，願你榮耀你的名！」當時有聲音從天上來，說：「我已經榮耀了我的名，還要再榮耀。」

words.note: Refers to God the Father in Christian context.
Often used in religious contexts for divine glory.
Lit. 'above heaven', implying the divine realm.

verses.text: 站在旁邊的群眾聽見了，就說：「打雷了。」另外有人說：「有天使對他說話。」

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「這聲音不是為了我，而是為了你們發出的。

words.note: Here indicates emphasis or a completed action's result.

verses.text: 現在是這世界受審判的時候了，現在這世界的王要被趕出去。

words.note: A key theological term in the Bible.
Indicates a new situation or completion.
Here refers to Satan, the 'ruler of this world'.
Verb-complement construction indicating direction.

verses.text: 我若從地上被舉起來，就要吸引萬人歸向我。」

words.note: Refers to Jesus' crucifixion and ascension. Verb-complement.
Literally 'ten thousand people,' meaning 'multitudes' or 'all kinds of people'.
Often used in religious contexts for conversion or allegiance.

verses.text: 他說這話，是指著自己將要怎樣死說的。

words.note: Emphasizes the manner of death.

verses.text: 於是群眾對他說：「我們從律法上知道基督是永遠常存的，你怎麼說『人子必須被舉起來』呢？這人子是誰呢？」

words.note: Refers to the Jewish Law (Torah).
Used here to mean 'from' or 'in accordance with' the law.
Often used in theological contexts for eternal existence.
A key Messianic title for Jesus in the Gospels.
Refers to Jesus' crucifixion and ascension. Verb-complement.
A key Messianic title for Jesus in the Gospels.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「光在你們中間的時間不多了。你們應當趁著有光的時候行走，免得黑暗追上你們。在黑暗中行走的人，不知道往哪裡去。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for truth, guidance, or divine presence in the Bible.
Indicates a new situation or completion.
Often used metaphorically for truth, guidance, or divine presence in the Bible.
Can imply a way of living or behaving.
Often used metaphorically for evil, ignorance, or spiritual death in the Bible.
Often used metaphorically for evil, ignorance, or spiritual death in the Bible.
Often used as a suffix to indicate 'within' or 'in the midst of'.
Can imply a way of living or behaving.
Used to turn the preceding phrase into a nominal modifier.

verses.text: 你們應當趁著有光的時候信從這光，使你們成為光明的兒女。」耶穌說完了這些話，就離開他們隱藏起來。

words.note: In biblical contexts, often means 'offspring' without gender specificity.

verses.text: 主的道要審判不信的人耶穌在他們面前行了許多神蹟，但是他們仍然不信他。

words.note: A title referring to God or Jesus.
Refers to God's word, truth, or way of teaching.

verses.text: 這是要應驗以賽亞先知所說的話：「主啊，我們所傳的，有誰信呢？主的膀臂向誰顯露呢？」

words.note: Often used in the context of prophecy fulfillment.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb, meaning 'what is V-ed'.
Used metaphorically to represent strength or power, especially God's power.

verses.text: 他們不能相信，因為以賽亞又說：
「 神使他們瞎了眼，硬了心，免得他們眼睛看見，心裡明白而回轉過來；我就醫好他們。」

words.note: Refers to the Creator God.
Used transitively here, meaning 'to make blind'.
Used transitively here, meaning 'to make hard'.

verses.text: 以賽亞說這些話，是因為看見了他的榮耀，就指著他說的。

words.note: Indicates completed action.
Used to emphasize the speaker or manner of an action.

verses.text: 雖然這樣，官長當中也有許多人信了耶穌。但是因為法利賽人的緣故，他們不敢公開承認，免得被趕出會堂；

words.note: Indicates completed action.

verses.text: 因為他們愛人的榮耀，過於愛 神的榮耀。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 耶穌大聲說：「信我的，不單是信我，也是信那差我來的。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase meaning 'those who...' or 'the one who...'
Indicates a modifying clause, e.g., 'the one who...'

verses.text: 看見我的，就是看見那差我來的。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase meaning 'those who...' or 'the one who...'
Indicates a modifying clause, e.g., 'the one who...'

verses.text: 我是光，我到世上來，叫所有信我的不住在黑暗裡。

words.note: Refers to the human world or earth.

verses.text: 人若聽見我的話卻不遵守的，我不審判他，因為我來不是要審判世人，而是要拯救世人。

words.note: Resultative verb compound: 'listen' + 'perceive'.
Often refers to divine judgment in religious texts.
Refers to humanity in general.
A key term for salvation in Christian theology.

verses.text: 棄絕我又不接受我的話的人，自有審判他的。我所講的道在末日要定他的罪；

words.note: Implies an automatic or inherent consequence.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun-like entity, 'that which judges him'.
Used to form a nominal phrase, like 'that which...' or 'what...'.
In a biblical context, often refers to God's Word or message.

words.definition: the last day, end of days
words.note: A theological term for the day of final judgment.
Refers to moral or religious wrongdoing.

verses.text: 因為我沒有憑著自己說話，而是差我來的父給了我命令，要我說甚麼，講甚麼。

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'speak words'.
Often implies sending on a mission or assignment.
Refers to God the Father in Christian theology.

verses.text: 我知道他的命令就是永生。所以，我所講的，正是父吩咐我要我講的。」

words.note: A central concept in Christian belief regarding life after death.
